File /global/alias.c

The alias control module for players.

Written by Pinkfish

Inherits

This class inherits the following classes /global/history.c

Includes

This class includes the following files /include/alias.h, /include/player.h and /include/playtesters.h

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
add_player_alias
int add_player_alias(string name,
mixed * value)
This method sets the alias to the new value.

Parameters:
name - the name of the alias
value - the value to set the alias too
See also:
query_player_alias()
alias_commands
void alias_commands()
This method adds all the alias commands onto the player. The commands are 'alias', 'unalias', 'ealias', 'END_ALIAS' and the "*" pattern expand the alias.

is_alias
int is_alias(string verb)
This method tells us if the given name is an alias.

Parameters:
verb - the verb to check
Returns:
1 if it is an alias, 0 if not
query_aliases
mapping query_aliases()
This method returns a complete list of all the aliases defined on the player. This is the internal mapping so it will be quite unreadable.

Returns:
the mapping of aliases
See also:
print_aliases() and /include/alias.h
query_player_alias
mixed * query_player_alias(string name)
This method returns the value of the specified alias.

Parameters:
name - the name of the alias to query
Returns:
the value of the alias
See also:
add_player_alias()
remove_alias_thing
int remove_alias_thing(string verb)
This is called to signify the end of an alias. This is needed keep track of recursive aliases and such like.

Parameters:
verb - the verb name to remove
Returns:
always returns 1
See also:
set_doing_alias() and is_doing_alias()
remove_all_aliases
int remove_all_aliases()
This method zaps all the current aliases defined. This can only be called by a high lord.

Returns:
0 on failure and 1 on success
remove_player_alias
int remove_player_alias(string name)
This method will remove the alias from the player.

Parameters:
name - the name of the alias
See also:
query_player_alias() and add_player_alias()

Protected Functions

These are functions that only objects inheriting the class can access.

exec_alias
void exec_alias(string verb,
string args)
This method runs the alias and executes all the commands in the alias. You should probably use run_alias() instead. This calls set_doing_alias() to setup blocking.

Parameters:
verb - the name of the alias
args - the arguments associated with the alias
See also:
run_alias() and set_doing_alias()
expand_alias
string * expand_alias(string verb,
string args)
This method expands the alias from the input string thingy.

Parameters:
verb - the verb to expand
args - the arguments to the verb
See also:
run_alias()
is_doing_alias
int is_doing_alias(string verb)
This method checks to see if the player is doing the specified alias already.

Parameters:
verb - the verb to check
See also:
exec_alias() and set_doing_alias()
run_alias
string * run_alias(string verb,
string args)
Attempt to expand the alias. This will look up the alias and see if it is defined. If it is, it will attempt to expand the alias. This does not call set_doing_alias(). This will return 0 if the alias does not exist, or the alias is already being run.

Parameters:
verb - the name of the alias to expand
args - the arguments to the alias
Returns:
the array if the alias was expanded, 0 if failed
See also:
exec_alias(), is_doing_alias(), set_doing_alias() and expand_alias()
set_doing_alias
void set_doing_alias(string verb)
This method sets us as currently doing the given alias.

Parameters:
verb - the alias to do
See also:
is_doing_alias()
